title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-Debt-Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep hours, calculate their sleep debt, and visualize their sleep patterns, providing valuable insights into their sleep health.  It's a practical application showcasing TypeScript development within a web project.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code and generated HTML output for my resume. It serves as a personal project demonstrating LaTeX proficiency for document generation and HTML for web presentation. The project leverages TeX for its superior typesetting capabilities and generates an HTML version for easier online sharing and accessibility.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository hosts a project leveraging JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to create an interactive dashboard. This project aims to provide a user-friendly interface, potentially for monitoring or controlling robotic systems, as implied by the "robofleet" naming. It serves as a learning or demonstration project showcasing web development technologies in the context of robotics-related applications.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a modern, decentralized voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a project to explore secure and transparent voting mechanisms. It leverages cutting-edge web technologies to provide a user-friendly and robust platform for creating and participating in elections and polls, focusing on user authentication and secure data handling to ensure fair and reliable results.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic Event Calendar is a project showcasing a customizable and interactive calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository provides a foundation for creating a visually appealing and user-friendly event calendar that can be easily integrated into web applications. It's a practical example of front-end development techniques and demonstrates how to handle event data and display it effectively within a calendar interface.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: The `iot-asset-tracking` repository showcases a modern, full-stack web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, Supabase, and Tailwind CSS for managing and tracking IoT assets. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of real-time data visualization and asset monitoring, utilizing key web development technologies and best practices for a scalable and maintainable solution.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next Idea Board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to be a dynamic and collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. This interactive application allows users to visually map out concepts, connect related thoughts, and ultimately structure their next big project, leveraging modern web technologies for a seamless and engaging experience.

title: devboard
description: DevBoard is a Next.js 14 project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a modern development dashboard implementation. Utilizing the Pages Router, MUI component library, and React Query for efficient data fetching, this repository provides a practical example of building a robust and visually appealing web application. It explores key concepts in Next.js development and demonstrates effective integration of popular libraries for streamlined development workflows.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built with Jupyter Notebook and Python, serves as a practical project exploring financial analysis and modeling techniques. It leverages Python's powerful data science libraries to analyze financial data, build models for investment strategies, and visualize key financial metrics. The project focuses on hands-on learning and aims to provide a solid foundation in applying Python to real-world finance problems.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting designed to visualize and analyze ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. This project aims to provide a user-friendly interface for developers to efficiently debug and understand ROS system behavior through interactive log viewing, filtering, and analysis capabilities, contributing to the broader ROS ecosystem.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This repository showcases a map visualization project built using HTML and Python. It aims to create interactive and informative maps for data representation, leveraging these languages to process geographical data and present it in a visually appealing format on a web-based interface. The project focuses on exploring different mapping techniques and data visualization methods to effectively communicate spatial information.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, providing a user-friendly interface using HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting. This project showcases the implementation of fundamental web development concepts and aims to demonstrate a practical example of creating, reading, updating, and deleting data within a relational database environment using a Python-based web framework.

title: atg-world
description: ATG World is a personal project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, aiming to create an interactive and engaging user experience. This repository showcases development skills and experimentation with front-end technologies while exploring various project-based concepts.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard implementation using the Next.js framework. This repository provides a foundation for building data-driven web applications with a focus on user interface design and efficient data visualization techniques. It serves as a learning resource and starting point for developers interested in exploring Next.js and its capabilities for building dynamic dashboards.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven-v2 is a project built using TypeScript and JavaScript, exploring [mention the project's specific domain/purpose from the README, e.g., advanced UI components, a novel data visualization technique, a full-stack application]. This repository serves as a learning and development platform, focused on [mention specific topics or functionalities, e.g., modular architecture, real-time data processing, serverless deployments], and aims to [mention the ultimate goal of the project, e.g., provide a reusable component library, demonstrate cutting-edge web development practices, streamline a specific workflow].

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide users with a conversational AI experience. This project aims to demonstrate the integration of cutting-edge AI technologies with modern web development practices, incorporating CSS, JavaScript, and HTML for a dynamic and engaging user interface.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a full-stack e-commerce web application built using Next.js 14 with the Pages Router, TypeScript, and React. It leverages MUI for the UI components, React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, and is designed as a practice project to demonstrate modern web development techniques within the realm of online fruit sales. The project aims to provide a robust and type-safe foundation for building scalable e-commerce solutions.
